Leadership in Quick Service — Firehouse Subs (Tsawwassen)



Context. Busy lunchtime traffic with strict opening SLAs. Role. Opening shift lead coordinating prep, food safety checks, and first‑hour throughput.



Checklist-driven open (equipment warm-up, line setup, temp checks)


Delegated prep by station; verified labeling & FIFO rotation


Managed front counter & POS, resolved order issues, supported new staff



Outcome. Reliable open, fewer reworks, smoother guest flow at peak.




©2025 Rupinder Kaur

<h1>Rupinder Kaur</h1>
<h3>A Bit About Me</h3>
<p>I am an MBA student at UCW (Vancouver) and an opening shift lead at Firehouse Subs, Tsawwassen.
I enjoy fast-paced teamwork, hospitality, and process-driven operations that deliver a great guest experience.</p>





Highlights



Opening shift lead: execute checklist-driven open, delegate prep, verify food safety & labeling.


Customer-first service: handle POS, resolve issues quickly, and support teammates under pressure.


Reliable & punctual: consistent store readiness before the first lunch rush.





Quick Stats



Location: Vancouver, BC


Program: MBA at UCW


Current role: Opening Shift Lead, Firehouse Subs (Tsawwassen)

title: Resume / CV
text:
Experience

Firehouse Subs, Tsawwassen — Opening Shift Lead

Food handling and preparation (meat slicing/weighing, ingredient prep, sandwich assembly).
Store sanitation and organization; ensure food labeling and storage.
POS operation for orders and payments; end-of-shift cash reconciliation.
Morning open via checklist; train/coordinate teammates on standards.
Maintain consistent presentation and guest experience.
